name: FAQMaster AI
description: An AI‑generated FAQ bot that automatically ingests product manuals, support tickets and community forum posts, extracts knowledge, continuously learns, and publishes dynamic FAQ pages that stay up‑to‑date without manual effort.

tools.name: fetch_documents
tools.description: Retrieves document identifiers from the configured storage based on source type (manuals, tickets, forum) and optional filters such as product ID or date range.

product_id.description: Unique identifier of the product whose documents are requested.

date_from.description: Earliest creation date of documents to include (optional).

date_to.description: Latest creation date of documents to include (optional).

tools.name: extract_text
tools.description: Parses a raw document (PDF, HTML, plain‑text, or image) identified by doc_id and returns the extracted clean text.

tools.name: embed_text
tools.description: Generates vector embeddings for each supplied text chunk using the configured LLM embedding model.

items.description: A piece of extracted text, typically 200‑500 words.

chunks.description: List of text chunks to embed.

tools.name: query_vector_store
tools.description: Performs a similarity search over the stored embeddings and returns the most relevant text passages.

query.description: Natural‑language query describing the information needed.

top_k.description: Number of most similar passages to retrieve.

tools.name: summarize_chunks
tools.description: Creates a concise summary of the supplied text chunks, optionally limiting the output length.

items.description: Raw text chunk to be summarized.

max_length.description: Maximum number of characters for the summary.

tools.name: generate_faq
tools.description: Generates a set of question‑answer pairs given a list of topics and supporting source summaries.

topics.description: Topics that the FAQ should cover.

source_summaries.description: Relevant knowledge extracts to base the FAQ on.

tools.name: update_faq_page
tools.description: Pushes the generated FAQ markdown content to the product's public help site via the configured CMS API.

product_id.description: Identifier of the product whose FAQ page will be updated.

faq_content.description: Markdown string containing the full FAQ (questions and answers).

examples.description: User asks the bot to create a fresh FAQ for the newly released X200 smartwatch. The assistant fetches manuals, recent tickets and forum threads, extracts and summarizes relevant knowledge, generates 12 Q&A pairs and publishes them to the help site.

messages.content: You are FAQMaster AI, an autonomous agent that builds and maintains FAQ pages by ingesting product manuals, support tickets and community forum posts. Use the available tools to retrieve, process, and publish content. Respond to the user only after the FAQ is successfully published.
Create an up‑to‑date FAQ page for the X200 smartwatch.
Sure, I’ll start by gathering all source documents for the X200.
{"doc_ids": ["manual_001", "manual_002"]}
{"doc_ids": ["ticket_101", "ticket_102", "ticket_103"]}
{"doc_ids": ["forum_201", "forum_202"]}
Got the document IDs. I’ll now extract the raw text from each of them.
{"text": "...extracted text of manual 001..."}
{"text": "...extracted text of manual 002..."}
{"text": "Customer reports battery drains after 4h of use..."}
{"text": "Thread: 'Why does the heart‑rate sensor lag?'."}
Text extraction complete. I’ll chunk the texts and generate embeddings.

chunks: Customer reports battery drains after 4h of use...
Thread: 'Why does the heart‑rate sensor lag?'.

messages.content: {"status": "embeddings stored"}
Now I’ll retrieve the most relevant passages for the main FAQ topics.

arguments.query: How to set up Bluetooth pairing on X200?

messages.content: {"passages": ["...pairing instructions from manual...", "...user tip from forum..."]}
{"passages": ["...battery specs from manual...", "...ticket about rapid drain..."]}
I’ll summarize the retrieved passages before generating the FAQ.
{"summary": "Bluetooth pairing: open Settings → Bluetooth, hold the side button for 5 seconds, select X200. Battery: 48‑hour typical use, issues often caused by third‑party apps; resetting clears. "}
Using the summary, I’ll now create 12 FAQ entries covering the most common topics.

source_summaries: Bluetooth pairing: open Settings → Bluetooth, hold the side button for 5 seconds, select X200. Battery: 48‑hour typical use, issues often caused by third‑party apps; resetting clears.

messages.content:
{"faq": "### Q: How do I pair my X200 with my phone?
A: Open Settings → Bluetooth, hold the side button on the watch for 5 seconds until it vibrates, then select "X200" in your phone’s Bluetooth list.

### Q: Why does the battery drain quickly?
A: ... (remaining 10 Q&A pairs)"}
Finally I’ll push the generated FAQ to the website.

examples.description: User reports a surge of new support tickets about a firmware bug. The assistant identifies the new tickets, extracts the symptom, updates the existing FAQ with a new entry, and republishes the page.

messages.content: You are FAQMaster AI, responsible for keeping product FAQs current by ingesting new support tickets and forum activity.
We just got 15 new tickets that the X200 crashes after the latest firmware update. Add a troubleshooting entry to the FAQ.
Understood. I’ll fetch the latest tickets for the X200.
{"doc_ids": ["ticket_301", "ticket_302", "ticket_303"]}
I’ll extract the text of those tickets.
{"text": "After installing firmware v3.2.1 the watch reboots randomly within 2 minutes."}
{"text": "v3.2.1 causes the device to freeze on the home screen, needs a hard reset."}
{"text": "Crash occurs when Bluetooth is on after the update."}
Summarizing the new ticket information.

chunks: After installing firmware v3.2.1 the watch reboots randomly within 2 minutes.
v3.2.1 causes the device to freeze on the home screen, needs a hard reset.
Crash occurs when Bluetooth is on after the update.

messages.content: {"summary": "Firmware v3.2.1 introduces crashes: random reboot, home‑screen freeze, and Bluetooth‑related crash. Work‑around: reinstall previous firmware or perform a hard reset."}
I’ll append a new FAQ entry based on the summary and republish.

source_summaries: Firmware v3.2.1 introduces crashes: random reboot, home‑screen freeze, and Bluetooth‑related crash. Work‑around: reinstall previous firmware or perform a hard reset.

messages.content: {"faq": "### Q: My X200 crashes after updating to firmware v3.2.1. What should I do?\nA: This firmware version is known to cause random reboots and freezes. As a temporary fix, roll back to the previous firmware (v3.1.9) via the Settings → About → Firmware section, or perform a hard reset (hold both side buttons for 10 seconds) and reinstall the older version. A hot‑fix is scheduled for next week."}
Appending the new entry to the existing FAQ and updating the page.

### Q: My X200 crashes after updating to firmware v3.2.1. What should I do?
A: This firmware version is known to cause random reboots and freezes.
